docs.snippet: When Venezuelan fencer and former sports minister Alejandra Benitez was eliminated in her second-round bout at the Rio Games, she wore a uniform emblazoned with the eyes of the country's divisive late leader, Hugo Chavez....
docs.lead_paragraph: When Venezuelan fencer and former sports minister Alejandra Benitez was eliminated in her second-round bout at the Rio Games, she wore a uniform emblazoned with the eyes of the country's divisive late leader, Hugo Chavez.

headline.main: Chavez Casts Divisive Shadow Over Venezuelan Sport at Games

docs.snippet: In Brazil, many of us are so obsessed with how the outside world sees us that we won’t recognize our own faults....
docs.lead_paragraph: In Brazil, many of us are so obsessed with how the outside world sees us that we won’t recognize our own faults.
docs.abstract: Vanessa Barbara Op-Ed article defends her past criticism of Olympic Games in Rio de Janeiro, noting she loves her country and it is only Olympic Games she takes issue with; marvels at ways Brazilians have sought to dismiss criticisms and pretend that there are no problems while the rest of world is watching; warns those problems will remain when sports fans and cameras leave.

headline.main: I Criticized the Olympics. That Doesn’t Make Me a Traitor.
headline.print_headline: I Love Brazil, Not the Olympics

docs.snippet: A blustery storm, a touch of melancholy and a sense of pride converged at the closing ceremony of the 2016 Olympics on Sunday as Brazil breathed a collective sigh of relief at having pulled off South America's first Games....
docs.lead_paragraph: A blustery storm, a touch of melancholy and a sense of pride converged at the closing ceremony of the 2016 Olympics on Sunday as Brazil breathed a collective sigh of relief at having pulled off South America's first Games.

headline.main: Rainy Rio Wraps Up Challenging Games on Upbeat Tropical Note

docs.snippet: Adilson da Silva of Brazil hit the first shot that put golf back in the Olympics for the first time in more than a century. Inbee Park hit the final putt that capped off two weeks that could not have gone much better for a sport trying to make a g...
docs.lead_paragraph: Adilson da Silva of Brazil hit the first shot that put golf back in the Olympics for the first time in more than a century. Inbee Park hit the final putt that capped off two weeks that could not have gone much better for a sport trying to make a good impression.

headline.main: Golf Leaves Rio in Better Shape Than When It Arrived
headline.print_headline: Golf Leaves Rio in Better Shape Than When It Arrived

docs.snippet: Kyle Snyder of the United States won the last wrestling gold medal of the Rio Olympics on Sunday but Mongolia provided the most vivid drama when two of its coaches stripped off in protest at their man's defeat in an earlier bout....
docs.lead_paragraph: Kyle Snyder of the United States won the last wrestling gold medal of the Rio Olympics on Sunday but Mongolia provided the most vivid drama when two of its coaches stripped off in protest at their man's defeat in an earlier bout.

headline.main: Wrestling: U.S. Grab Last Gold, Mongolian Strip-Off Steals Show

docs.snippet: The American owners of Liverpool, one of the most famous teams in English soccer, are not planning to sell, a senior source at the club said on Sunday, after reports that a Chinese-backed consortium wanted to buy a sizeable stake....
docs.lead_paragraph: The American owners of Liverpool, one of the most famous teams in English soccer, are not planning to sell, a senior source at the club said on Sunday, after reports that a Chinese-backed consortium wanted to buy a sizeable stake.

headline.main: Liverpool Not for Sale Despite Chinese Interest-Source
headline.print_headline: Liverpool Not for Sale Despite Chinese Interest-Source
